villagers.name: Abigail
villagers.biography: Abigail lives at the general store with her parents. She sometimes fights with her mom, who worries about Abigail's 'alternative lifestyle'. Her mom has the following to say: 'I wish Abby would dress more appropriately and stop dyeing her hair blue. She has such a wonderful natural hair color, just like her grandmother did.'
villagers.schedule: Usually at Pierre's General Store or in her room. On Fridays, she's often at the Saloon in the evening. She plays video games and practices flute.
villagers.location: Pierre's General Store, town square, or her bedroom

villagers.name: Alex
villagers.biography: Alex lives with his grandparents, George and Evelyn. He takes his gridball very seriously and dreams of going pro. Alex loves his dog, Dusty, who lives in a fenced area behind his grandparents' house.
villagers.schedule: Usually near his house or at the beach during summer. Works out by the tree east of town. Visits the Spa on Sundays.
villagers.location: 1 River Road (George & Evelyn's house), beach, or town square

villagers.name: Elliott
villagers.biography: Elliott lives alone in a cabin on the beach. He is a writer who dreams of one day writing a magnificent novel. He is a sentimental 'romantic' with a tendency to go off onto flowery, poetic tangents.
villagers.schedule: Usually at his cabin on the beach, at the Saloon in the evenings, or at the library. Sometimes walks along the beach or to Pierre's shop.
villagers.location: Elliott's Cabin (beach), Stardrop Saloon, or library

villagers.name: Emily
villagers.biography: Emily lives with her sister Haley in town. She works as a server at the Saloon. She's friendly and bubbly, interested in crystals, spirituality, and dreams. She makes her own clothing.
villagers.schedule: Works at the Saloon on most evenings. At home during the day (2 Willow Lane). Sometimes at the beach or community center.
villagers.location: 2 Willow Lane, Stardrop Saloon, or beach

villagers.name: Haley
villagers.biography: Haley lives with her sister Emily. She can be shallow and conceited at first, but has a softer side. She likes to photograph nature, particularly during Spring. She dislikes dirt and labor.
villagers.schedule: Often at home (2 Willow Lane), shopping at Pierre's, taking photographs around town, or at the beach during spring/summer.
villagers.location: 2 Willow Lane, Pierre's General Store, or town square

villagers.name: Harvey
villagers.biography: Harvey is the town doctor. He's a little old for a bachelor, but he has a kind heart and a respected position in the community. He lives alone in an apartment above the medical clinic.
villagers.schedule: Usually at the medical clinic during the day. Sometimes at the Saloon in evenings or walking through town. Enjoys coffee.
villagers.location: Harvey's Clinic or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Leah
villagers.biography: Leah lives alone in a small cabin just outside of town. She loves to spend time outside, foraging for wild mushrooms and working on her art. She's very talented and has a strong passion for nature.
villagers.schedule: At her cottage south of the farm, foraging in the forest, at the Saloon on Fridays, or at Pierre's shop. Often by the lake or river.
villagers.location: Leah's Cottage (Cindersap Forest), Pierre's General Store, or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Maru
villagers.biography: Maru is a talented young woman who lives in the mountains with her family. Her father, Demetrius, is a scientist, and her mother, Robin, is a carpenter. Maru is particularly interested in gadgets and robotics.
villagers.schedule: Usually at home (Mountain), working at the clinic as a nurse, or tinkering with gadgets. Sometimes at the Saloon on Fridays.
villagers.location: Mountain (Robin's house), Harvey's Clinic, or near the telescope

villagers.name: Penny
villagers.biography: Penny lives with her mother Pam in a small trailer by the river. She tutors Jas and Vincent at the library. She's shy and modest, without much money. She's one of the most reserved and kindest souls in town.
villagers.schedule: At the trailer, teaching Jas and Vincent at the library/museum, at the town playground, or reading books. Visits the Saloon sometimes.
villagers.location: Trailer (River Road), Library/Museum, or town playground

villagers.name: Sam
villagers.biography: Sam is an outgoing, friendly guy who is brimming with youthful energy. He plays guitar and drums, and wants to start a band with Sebastian and Abigail. His mom, Jodi, and his dad, Kent (who returns in year 2), both live with him, along with his little brother, Vincent.
villagers.schedule: At home (1 Willow Lane), skateboarding near the museum, at the Saloon with Sebastian and Abigail on Fridays, or at the beach.
villagers.location: 1 Willow Lane (Jodi's house), town square, or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Sebastian
villagers.biography: Sebastian is a rebellious loner who lives in his parents' basement. He is Maru's half-brother, and feels like his sister gets all the attention. He dreams of moving to the city.
villagers.schedule: Usually in his room in the basement (Mountain house), at the Saloon on Fridays, smoking by the lake, or working on his motorcycle.
villagers.location: Mountain (Robin's house - basement), Stardrop Saloon, or by the mountain lake

villagers.name: Shane
villagers.biography: Shane is a villager who is mostly aloof and unfriendly towards the player. He lives with his aunt Marnie and works at JojaMart. He seems unhappy and can be rude. He's the godfather of Jas and cares deeply about her.
villagers.schedule: Works at JojaMart most days, at the Saloon in the evenings (especially Fridays), or at Marnie's Ranch. Sometimes visits the cliffs.
villagers.location: Marnie's Ranch, JojaMart, or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Caroline
villagers.biography: Caroline is married to Pierre and is the mother of Abigail. She lives at Pierre's General Store. She's friendly and gracious, teaches aerobics, and has a sun room where she loves to tend plants.
villagers.schedule: At Pierre's General Store, in her sun room, at aerobics class on Tuesdays, or at the Saloon occasionally.
villagers.location: Pierre's General Store

villagers.name: Clint
villagers.biography: Clint is the town blacksmith. He lives in a small house attached to his shop. He's a lonely bachelor and has a secret crush on Emily, though he's too shy to tell her.
villagers.schedule: At his blacksmith shop during working hours. Visits the Saloon on Fridays. Occasionally at the library.
villagers.location: Blacksmith shop or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Demetrius
villagers.biography: Demetrius is Robin's husband and Maru's father. He's a scientist who studies the valley's ecosystem. He lives in the mountains with his family and has high standards for anyone interested in his daughter.
villagers.schedule: At home in the mountains, working in his lab, examining nature around town, or at the Saloon occasionally.
villagers.location: Mountain (Robin's house) or examining specimens near the lake

villagers.name: Dwarf
villagers.biography: The Dwarf lives in the mines and speaks Dwarvish, which can only be understood after donating all 4 Dwarvish scrolls to the museum. The Dwarf is a merchant who sells rare items.
villagers.schedule: Always at the shop in the mines (eastern cave).
villagers.location: Eastern cave in the mines

villagers.name: Evelyn
villagers.biography: Evelyn is George's wife and Alex's grandmother. She's one of the oldest and sweetest residents of Pelican Town. She's kind to everyone and loves flowers, especially her tulips.
villagers.schedule: At home (1 River Road), tending her garden, at Pierre's shop, or in the town square.
villagers.location: 1 River Road (George's house) or town square

villagers.name: George
villagers.biography: George is Alex's grandfather and Evelyn's husband. He's a grumpy old man who is confined to a wheelchair. Despite his rough exterior, he cares deeply for his family.
villagers.schedule: At home (1 River Road) in his wheelchair, in front of the TV, or occasionally outside in good weather.
villagers.location: 1 River Road (his house)

villagers.name: Gus
villagers.biography: Gus is the owner and chef of the Stardrop Saloon. He's a friendly guy who loves to cook and serve the townspeople. He takes pride in his establishment.
villagers.schedule: Almost always at the Stardrop Saloon, cooking and serving customers.
villagers.location: Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Jas
villagers.biography: Jas is a young girl who lives with her aunt Marnie. Her godfather is Shane. She's friends with Vincent and loves playing with him. She's innocent and sweet.
villagers.schedule: At Marnie's Ranch, playing in town square with Vincent, or being tutored at the museum/library by Penny.
villagers.location: Marnie's Ranch, town square playground, or museum/library

villagers.name: Jodi
villagers.biography: Jodi is Sam and Vincent's mother. Her husband Kent was away at war (returns year 2). She's a dedicated housewife who takes care of her family and home.
villagers.schedule: At home (1 Willow Lane) doing housework, shopping at Pierre's, or exercising with Caroline on Tuesdays.
villagers.location: 1 Willow Lane (her house) or Pierre's General Store

villagers.name: Kent
villagers.biography: Kent is Jodi's husband and Sam and Vincent's father. He returns from military service in Year 2. He suffers from PTSD and is working on adjusting back to civilian life.
villagers.schedule: Appears in Year 2. Usually at home (1 Willow Lane), walking around town, or at the Saloon.
villagers.location: 1 Willow Lane (available Year 2+)

villagers.name: Krobus
villagers.biography: Krobus is a shadow person who lives in the sewers. He's shy and reclusive but friendly once you get to know him. He can become your roommate instead of marrying.
villagers.schedule: Always in the sewers. Unlocked after getting the Rusty Key.
villagers.location: The Sewers

villagers.name: Leo
villagers.biography: Leo is a young boy who lives on Ginger Island. He was raised by parrots after his parents were lost at sea. He's innocent and has a special connection with nature.
villagers.schedule: On Ginger Island until you complete his quest, then moves to the mountains with Linus. Plays around the island or mountains.
villagers.location: Ginger Island or Mountain (after moving to valley)

villagers.name: Lewis
villagers.biography: Lewis is the mayor of Pelican Town. He's been mayor for 20 years and takes his job seriously. He has a secret relationship with Marnie that he wants to keep hidden.
villagers.schedule: At his house, at Pierre's shop, walking around town, or secretly visiting Marnie's Ranch.
villagers.location: Mayor's Manor or around town square

villagers.name: Linus
villagers.biography: Linus is a homeless man who lives in a tent near the mines. He chooses to live simply and in harmony with nature. Despite his lifestyle, he's kind and knowledgeable.
villagers.schedule: At his tent near the mines, foraging around the mountains, or at the spa. Sometimes searches trash cans at night.
villagers.location: Mountain (near mines, his tent)

villagers.name: Marnie
villagers.biography: Marnie runs the ranch and raises animals. She's Shane's aunt and Jas's guardian. She has a secret relationship with Mayor Lewis and cares deeply for her animals.
villagers.schedule: At her ranch shop, taking care of animals, at Pierre's shop, or at the Saloon. Sometimes with Mayor Lewis.
villagers.location: Marnie's Ranch

villagers.name: Pam
villagers.biography: Pam is Penny's mother. She's the bus driver, though the bus is broken until you repair it. She has a drinking problem and lives in a trailer by the river.
villagers.schedule: At the trailer, at the bus stop (after bus is fixed), or at the Saloon drinking.
villagers.location: Trailer (River Road), bus stop, or Stardrop Saloon

villagers.name: Pierre
villagers.biography: Pierre runs Pierre's General Store with his wife Caroline. He's proud of his locally-sourced goods and is in competition with Joja Mart. He's Abigail's father, though Abigail sometimes wonders about this.
villagers.schedule: At Pierre's General Store during business hours, at home behind the shop, or at the Saloon on Wednesdays.
villagers.location: Pierre's General Store

villagers.name: Robin
villagers.biography: Robin is the local carpenter. She can upgrade your house and construct farm buildings. She's married to Demetrius, has a daughter Maru, and a son Sebastian from a previous relationship.
villagers.schedule: At her carpenter's shop in the mountains, working on construction projects, exercising with Caroline on Tuesdays, or at home.
villagers.location: Mountain (Robin's Carpenter Shop)

villagers.name: Sandy
villagers.biography: Sandy runs the Oasis shop in the Calico Desert. She's cheerful and friendly, though a bit lonely being so far from town. She's friends with Emily.
villagers.schedule: Always at the Oasis shop in the Calico Desert. Unlocked after repairing the bus.
villagers.location: The Oasis (Calico Desert)

villagers.name: Vincent
villagers.biography: Vincent is a young boy who lives with his mother Jodi and brother Sam (and father Kent in Year 2). He's best friends with Jas and loves playing and exploring.
villagers.schedule: At home (1 Willow Lane), playing in the town square playground with Jas, or being tutored by Penny at the museum/library.
villagers.location: 1 Willow Lane, town square playground, or museum/library

villagers.name: Willy
villagers.biography: Willy is a fisherman who runs the fish shop on the beach. He loves the sea and has spent his whole life fishing. He's gruff but kind-hearted.
villagers.schedule: At his fish shop on the beach, fishing on the dock, or occasionally at the Saloon.
villagers.location: Fish Shop (beach) or beach dock

villagers.name: Wizard
villagers.biography: The Wizard (M. Rasmodius) lives in a tower west of Cindersap Forest. He's mysterious and powerful, practicing magic. He was once married to the Witch. He gives you access to special buildings.
villagers.schedule: Always at the Wizard's Tower west of Cindersap Forest.
villagers.location: Wizard's Tower (west of Cindersap Forest)

universal_likes: All artisan goods (except Oil & Void Mayonnaise)
notes.gift_info: You can give each villager up to two gifts per week (plus one on their birthday). Birthday gifts give 8x friendship points. Best gifts are 'Loved' items.

tips.tip: Plant crops in a 3x3 grid around sprinklers to maximize efficiency and save energy.
Fishing in the rain increases your chances of catching better quality fish.
Hold down the tool button to keep using it without clicking repeatedly.
Gift villagers items on their birthday for 8x friendship points instead of the usual amount.
Place a chest next to your bed to store items you want to access quickly every morning.
Preserve jars and kegs turn crops into artisan goods worth significantly more than raw crops.
Ancient fruit wine is one of the most profitable items in the game.
Don't sell your first dinosaur egg - put it in the incubator to breed more dinosaurs.
Coffee plants keep producing beans every 2 days after the first harvest in Spring and Summer.
Lightning rods produce battery packs during storms, which are valuable for crafting.
Build a silo before cutting grass so you can store hay for your animals in winter.
The mines reset every time you enter, so you can farm specific floors for resources.
Crab pots near Willy's shop are the most profitable as they catch higher value items.
Plant fruit trees on the outer edges of your farm to maximize space.
Always carry emergency food in the mines to restore health quickly.
Check the traveling cart on Fridays and Sundays for rare items and seeds.
Befriend the Wizard early to unlock buildings like the Junimo Huts later.
Preserve your first prismatic shard for the Galaxy Sword at the Three Pillars.
Tappers on oak trees produce oak resin, essential for kegs which make wine.
Speed-Gro fertilizer reduces crop growth time, letting you harvest more per season.
Fill the Community Center before year 3 to unlock powerful rewards and areas.
Crystalariums duplicate gems - prioritize diamonds and jade for maximum profit.
Forage around town daily - free food and gifts are everywhere.
Install mods only after experiencing vanilla gameplay to appreciate improvements.
Pet your animals daily to increase friendship and improve product quality.
Hoe artifact spots (worm tiles) everywhere - they contain valuable items and artifacts.
Invest in quality sprinklers ASAP to automate watering and save time.
Level 5 and 10 professions significantly impact your strategy - choose wisely.
Kegs take 7 days to process but are worth more than preserve jars for most crops.
Strawberries in Spring and cranberries in Fall are the most profitable seasonal crops.
Fish ponds can produce roe which becomes aged roe - very profitable passive income.
Always bring a pickaxe to the mines - you never know when you'll need it.
Robin's shop is closed on Tuesdays - plan building upgrades accordingly.
Cheese and mayonnaise makers turn animal products into much more valuable items.
Don't waste stamina clearing your entire farm on day 1 - focus on small crop areas.
Salmonberries in Spring and blackberries in Fall are free energy food - stock up.
The Stardrop from the Stardew Valley Fair costs 2,000 star tokens - worth saving for.
Plant ancient seeds in the greenhouse for year-round production.
Complete fishing bundles early to unlock crab pots from the reward.
Upgrade your backpack at Pierre's as soon as possible for more inventory space.
Bombs are more efficient than pickaxes for clearing large stone areas in mines.
Ginger Island unlocks after completing the Community Center - worth the effort.
Auto-grabbers collect animal products automatically - essential for large barns/coops.
Save at least one of every item for potential future quests or bundles.
Iridium sprinklers cover 24 tiles and are the ultimate farming automation tool.
Talk to villagers daily to increase friendship - conversations matter.
Skull Cavern has no bottom - bring lots of bombs and staircases for deep runs.
The Secret Woods has hardwood stumps that respawn - visit regularly.
Pigs find truffles which are extremely valuable - invest in them mid-game.
Hops are the most profitable Summer crop when turned into pale ale.
Check the TV daily for recipes, fortune, and tips from Livin' Off The Land.
Starfruit wine is incredibly profitable - grow in Summer or greenhouse.
The Bus to Calico Desert unlocks after completing the vault bundle.
Quality fertilizer increases crop quality - use on high-value crops.
Geodes can be processed at Clint's for minerals, artifacts, and gems.
Fishing treasure chests appear more often with higher fishing level and tackle.
Junimo Huts harvest crops automatically - place them centrally in crop fields.
Monster Musk attracts more enemies in mines for better loot drops.
Seed makers can duplicate rare seeds like ancient fruit and sweet gem berries.
Winter is perfect for mining, fishing, and upgrading tools at Clint's.
Hardwood fences last the longest before breaking - worth the investment.
Linus teaches you the sashimi recipe which is great for converting trash fish.
Teleport totems save massive amounts of travel time - craft them regularly.
Slime hutches produce slime which crafts eggs - breeding slimes is oddly profitable.
Marriage provides daily gifts and occasional farm help from your spouse.
Preserve jars work best for vegetables, kegs work best for fruits.
Galaxy souls upgrade galaxy weapons to infinity weapons - the best in game.
Seafoam pudding is the best fishing food - increases fishing skill significantly.
Rabbits occasionally drop rabbit's feet - universally loved gifts.
Fruit bats in the cave provide free fruit, mushrooms provide crafting materials.
Qi gems on Ginger Island unlock powerful perks and items in Mr. Qi's shop.
Wild seeds foraged from each season can be planted for more forage items.
Cask aging in the cellar increases wine and cheese quality for higher profits.
Fairy dust instantly ages products in casks - save for iridium quality items.
Lava katana from the Adventurer's Guild is great before getting Galaxy Sword.
Grass starters let animals graze outdoors, reducing hay costs significantly.
Bone fragments in the volcano dungeon craft powerful late-game items.
Golden scythes harvest hay more efficiently than regular scythes.
Cheese from gold star large milk becomes iridium cheese when aged.
Winning the grange display at the fair requires 9+ points - use variety.
Horse flutes let you call your horse from anywhere on the map.
Fairy rose honey is the most valuable honey type - plant fairy roses near hives.
Luau soup quality affects friendship with everyone - add gold star items.
Mahogany trees grow faster than other trees and provide better hardwood yields.
Warp totems to the farm save time when deep in mines or far from home.
Mining carts unlock fast travel between major locations - worth repairing.
Secret notes reveal hidden content - read them carefully for clues.
Loved gifts raise friendship much faster than liked gifts - prioritize them.
Void chickens from void eggs produce void mayonnaise worth good money.
Staircases let you skip boring mine levels - craft them for Skull Cavern runs.
Lucky days increase chances for finding rare items and good fortune in mines.
Pierre's secret stash has rare seeds - check behind his shop counter.
Autopetters keep animals happy without daily petting - Joja exclusive initially.
Mystic trees spawn randomly and drop mystic syrup - very valuable.
Spicy eel from serpents gives speed and luck buffs - perfect for mines.
Ostrich eggs produce 10 mayonnaise at once - great for bulk processing.
Tackle bobbers make fishing easier by increasing the catch bar size.
Panning for ore in rivers occasionally yields valuable minerals and artifacts.
Mushroom logs produce regular mushrooms - decent passive income source.
Hay can be bought from Marnie but growing grass yourself is free.
Recycling machines turn trash into useful items like cloth and refined quartz.
Fish smokers increase fish value by 50% - great for less valuable fish.
Mini-shipping bins let you ship items from anywhere on your farm.
Deluxe speed-gro on ancient fruit in greenhouse maximizes annual harvests.
Rings can be combined at the forge to create powerful dual-effect rings.
Cinder shards from volcano forge upgrade tools and weapons significantly.
Magic bait catches fish from any season or weather - very versatile.
Heaters keep animals happy in winter when they can't go outside.
Bait makers create bait from various items - saves money long term.
Tea saplings are cheap to make and sell well - good early money maker.
Remote farm computer shows overview of farm production and tasks.
Geode crushers process geodes instantly instead of waiting for Clint.
Mushroom cave helps complete cooking recipes needing mushrooms year-round.
